attributes.action: Don’t Railroad Soho: Save Soho from the CrossRail 2 Scheme
attributes.background: The future of Soho could change dramatically this coming June when we anticipate the transport minister announcing the approval of CrossRail 2. It will allow the demolition of two blocks for a new train station that will bring double the footfall of Kings Cross Underground into and around Soho.
attributes.additional_details:
That’s 270 thousand people every three hour peak right on the corner of Frith Street and Shaftesbury Avenue.  

We do not oppose CrossRail 2.  However, we oppose any decision to include Soho in the scheme.  

I have supported the Save Soho movement since it began and have assisted Tim Arnold and the Save Soho group whenever possible. 

Please join us by signing this petition for yours and our Soho.

Stephen Fry, chairman of Save Soho

attributes.action: Recognise care work is a skilled job and put a banding system in place
attributes.background: The average care worker is paid the minimum wage give or take 5%, regardless of whether or not they have experience and qualifications. It is said to be unskilled, yet there are various care qualifications sought after by employers. Why? Because care work is a skilled job which requires training!
attributes.additional_details: The current care system fails both care workers and service users. I propose that HCAs have a banding system. Band 1 will be apprentice carers, paid the minimum wage, band 2 will be level 2 carers and be paid 25%+ above minimum wage, band 3 (senior) +50%, and band 4 (deputy/coordinator) +75%. I also propose band 1 cannot lone work until 6 months shadowing has been done. This will encourage training, ensuring the quality of care provided is of the standard it desperately needs to be!

attributes.action: All Vegan products on sale in the UK should bear a standard identifying logo.
attributes.background: Shopping for Vegan products in the UK is notoriously difficult. Especially for those who are even the slightly visually impaired as ingredient lists are often in tiny print. This should include all food & drink products, health care & beauty products and clothing including shoes.

attributes.action: Review and change criteria that allow people to donate blood
attributes.background: Currently huge groups of people, such as men who have sex with men, are unable to donate blood, due to creteria based on out of date views and stereotypes. These need to be reviewed and the discrimination needs to stop! There are always adverts crying out for donors but they stop those willing!
attributes.additional_details: A gay man in a long term monogamous relationship can be denied as a donor, where a heterosexual man sleeping with multiple partners is allowed. This outdated view on men who have sex with men is fuelling the discrimination faced by them on a daily basis. This needs to be reviewed and changed and then perhaps there wouldn't be as many shortages. MSMs can be on the organ donor register and can sign up to the Anthony Nolan Trust so why shouldn't they be able to donate blood

attributes.action: Improve Testing for Lyme disease in UK and Treatment Guidelines
attributes.background: Lyme disease within the UK is a big problem and the NHS is refusing to recognize this, leaving many patients to spend thousands on private treatment or suffer in silence

attributes.action: Allow the British people to bear arms again
attributes.background: Because of the constant threat of islamic terrorism the British people should be allowed to bear arms in order to protect their families,
attributes.additional_details: Throughout Europe Islamic terrorists have killed hundreds of innocent people & to try to save lives then the British public should once again be allowed to carry guns to defend their loved ones from harm, We the British people want the same rights afforded to the people of the USA, France & Germany who do have the means to defend themselves when needed!!!

attributes.action: To have Epilepsy Awareness Month in the UK in the month of November
attributes.background: This month (November) it is National Epilepsy Awareness Month in the US.  In the UK we only have 8 days a year for Epilepsy Awareness and this clearly is nowhere near enough. I have decided to support the US in their amazing efforts and help raise awareness and funds during the month of November.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK, 600,000 or one in every 103 people has epilepsy. Every day in the UK, 87 people are diagnosed with epilepsy. Only 52 per cent of people with epilepsy in the UK are seizure-free. It is estimated that 70 per cent could be seizure free with the right treatment.  There are more than half a million people with epilepsy in the UK. Around 600 people die each year due to Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy.

attributes.action: Proscribe the extremist group Britain First
attributes.background: Far right propaganda on the internet and social media is all pervasive. Britain First's Facebook page reaches and influences millions a week. The Govt must proscribe Britain First .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/britain-first-muslim-elected-officials_uk_574352c4e4b0e71ef36d9617?edition=uk&b52pke8u54myousor

http://www.politics.co.uk/news/2014/06/19/britain-first-the-violent-new-face-of-british-fascism

These are just 2 of many links showing just how dangerous Britain First are.

attributes.action: Get involved in Nnamidi Kanu case considering that he is also a British citizen.
attributes.background: Nnamidi Kanu has been unjustly detained by Nigeria government for almost 2 years. The issue is now beyond a young man fighting for the freedom of his people but that of violation of his fundamental human right in several occassions. Injustice to one is injustice to all!!

attributes.action: Introduce a register of people who are convicted of animal cruelty
attributes.background: In light of the recent conviction for animal cruelty I am requesting the UK government to introduce a register to list the people who have been convicted and are banned from keeping animals. This would make enforcing and monitoring these bans more efficient

attributes.action: Raise the issue of the Taiji Dolphin slaughters with the Japanese Government
attributes.background: I've been horrified to learn & witness that every year in Taiji,Japan, dolphins are chased into a small cover and butchered in the most horrific and cruel way imaginable. The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.
attributes.additional_details: People across the world have been shocked by this act of cruelty that is live streamed by many welfare organisation to raise awareness, e.g. dolphin project, sea shepherd,racing against extinction etc. This year the order book for Taiji is 150 dolphins for captivity, anymore captured will be killed. The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Call Government to legislate & implement Lynn Faulds Wood Consumer Recall Report
attributes.background: The Lynn Faulds Wood review calls for an overhaul of the consumer product recall system in this country. This has been highlighted by the situation with Whirlpool. Without Government legislation, as one MP stated, companies will continue with 'corporate malpractice' with no thought for the consumer.
attributes.additional_details:
UK consumer product recall, An independent review by Lynn Faulds Wood
Adjournment debate by Andy Slaughter MP, Faulty Tumble Dryers (Fire Risk) on 13th September 2016

attributes.action: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.
attributes.background: Repeal the 1955 canal closure act.To prevent losing more of our Industrial Heritage.And stop developers building on disused canals and surrounding heritage.This will also give restoration groups the possibility of restoring derelict Canals.
attributes.additional_details: Without this act being repealed ,we cannot stop any Local authorities or CRT applying for a canal closure and granting planning permission on derelict canals or nearby heritage sites.

attributes.action: Highways England to set 50mph speed limit on A34 between Chieveley & West Ilsley
attributes.background: The A34 between Chieveley and West Ilsley currently has a national speed limit (70mph) and carries significant volumes of traffic past slip-roads with very poor intervisibility between vehicles joining and proceeding along the A34 at East Ilsley and Beedon. This results in frequent accidents.

attributes.action: Government to prevent local councils cease funds to maintain bowling facilities
attributes.background: Britain has an ageing population. Withdrawing funding will result in older and vulnerable people in our society becoming less mobile and lose their only social contact.  We want our national government to step in to prevent the destruction of this valuable sporting and recreational facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Many local councils are planning to withdraw funding to maintain bowling greens.  This short sighted action will have a knock on effect of less mobile, less fit elderly people.  The consequences are an increased demand on NHS and care facilities.

http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/news/15039978.Bowling_clubs__under_threat__from_Bradford_Council_cutbacks/

attributes.action: President Trump should be invited to address Parliament during visit
attributes.background: President Donald Trump should be welcomed to the UK in his capacity as head of the US Government and honour Her Majesty with a State visit and address the houses of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The UK and US enjoy a special relationship like no other two countries. While former president Obama wanted to send us to the back of the queue, President Trump promised to bring us to the front and partner with the UK on trade and security. President Trump showed the UK his respect by inviting PM May as the first foreign leader to visit him. Regardless of the opinion some hold of him, as the President of the US he deserves the respect he showed the UK.

attributes.action: Urgently increase the penalty for illegal fly tipping.
attributes.background: Incidents of large scale illegal fly tipping are occurring far to frequently and the fly tips are almost on an industrial scale, especially in rural areas. It is obvious to all that organised criminals have become involved and are profiting from fly tipping.
attributes.additional_details: There is no doubt that the crime of fly tipping is having a serious effect on the countryside, wildlife and communities - it can't be allowed to go on.

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in religious education lessons
attributes.background: All religions should be covered in the curriculum not just the chosen few.  The younger members of society should be able to make an informed choice to what religions are around and what they stand for.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect officers tackling motorbike & auto crime
attributes.background: Police officers have high levels of training in pursuit driving & tactical resolutions yet are afraid to use tactics i.e. Stop stick on motorbikes. There is no protection in law if something goes wrong and an offender is hurt. Motorbikes fail to stop regularly, commit crime & police can't pursue.
attributes.additional_details: Many crimes are carried out on motorcycles, robberies, shootings & drug dealing. Police wont pursue in case the criminals hurt themselves & officers are scared to use stop stick in case the criminal gets injured & they get blamed. Recent incidents in Merseyside have seen up to 60 motorbikes causing mayhem at one time, many on stolen bikes, riding on pavements, through red lights etc. Legislation is needed to protect officers so they can tackle this problem effectively & put blame on offenders.

attributes.action: I call for a vote of NO CONFIDENCE in this government!
attributes.background: Brexit is causing chaos to the United Kingdom and it's citizens, it is clear, the referendum as presented to the voter was based on lies and exagerations and the government is still continuing this trend, this must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Not allowing parliment to vote on when article 50 will be presented, nor allowing the majority of the United Kingdom to have a rethink, now that they know the real implications of the result of the advisory referendum.

attributes.action: Pass the same sentences for offences against animals as offences against humans
attributes.background: Every day you hear of terrible offences against animals, including cruelty, torture and murder. I propose the same sentencing for perpetrators of these crimes as there would be if they had committed the same offence against a human. The current sentences passed are too light.

attributes.action: Make egg manufacturers legally obliged to display a method of male chick culling
attributes.background:
UK legislation should provide an enforceable law that every egg pack produced in an egg factory must have a clearly visible and well readable statement what killing methods of male chicks are used in the given egg factory, for example:

"Method of male chick culling: Suffocation"
attributes.additional_details:
Chick culling is a common method of a male chick disposal as males don't lay eggs and are therefore unnecessary waste generating no financial or other profit for the egg industry.

It is morally unacceptable that egg manufacturers can accompany their products with images of happy hens whilst not revealing the information about this inhumane cruelty happening on a huge scale in their factory premises on a daily basis. That is effectively deceiving the consumers by a false advertisement.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt MP & Lord O’Shaughnessy: Remove Big Pharma Influence over MHRA
attributes.background:
The MHRA is funded by the Department of Health for the regulation of  medical devices, whilst the costs of medicines regulation is met through fees from the pharmaceutical industry.

The MHRA must become independent and entirely funded through public money as well as showing more transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The MHRA is the government body which licenses medicines in the UK. It's been criticised for its links with big pharmaceutical companies, whose financial interest is to promote their expensive products and limit cheaper and effective alternatives.

The MHRA doesn't allow the public to be involved in the implementation as a transparent process of drug licensing with public access to pharma companies' data is lacking. 

We want the secrecy to end and see financial dependency on pharma removed!

attributes.action: Ensure carbohydrate values are available in all premises serving food
attributes.background: My son has type 1 diabetes and controls this with insulin injections. Insulin requirements are calculated dependent upon carbohydrates in food, sadly we have found this information is not available in all food premises. Without this information available he is at risk of fitting.
attributes.additional_details:
If too much or too little insulin is provided, type one diabetics are at risk of potentially life threatening fits. Type 1 diabetes is a autoimmune disease and can not be controlled by diet. 
Please help those suffering from this horrible condition to lead as normal a life as possible.

attributes.action: Make Small council-maintained schools exempt from the Apprenticeship Levy.
attributes.background:
The Apprenticeship Levy, being introduced in April, will see all businesses including schools with a wage bill over £3 million a year contributing 0.5 per cent of that wage bill to fund new apprenticeships. 
Small schools are being treated unfairly and this needs to be reviewed!
attributes.additional_details:
Small schools with a smaller wage bill that are maintained by the LA will also be expected to pay the Levy and will need to account for this in their separate small school budgets. 
Academies and faith schools are exempt from this - small schools are being treated unfairly, and their already struggling budgets are surely taking the hit!

attributes.action: Child maintenance payments to be worked out from NET pay not GROSS pay.
attributes.background: Child maintenance should be work out for the paying parent from there NET pay NOT from there GROSS pay as the working parent does not even see nor take home in the bank the GROSS pay so they are getting penalized twice from the tax man and Child maintenance
attributes.additional_details:
Example: - Parent on £36,000 per year GROSS pay. 
Actual take home pay £24,000 per year NET pay. 
Child maintenance work out your weekly pay from £36,000 this would be £692.00 per week in pay. When actually your weekly take home pay is £461.00 
Action needs to be taken so that child maintenance is worked out from your NET pay not your GROSS pay as parents just cannot afford to live taking money from parents that do not even see this in the bank accounts. 

Please sign and make this happen for the paying parent. Everyone should pay for there child but it has to be fair.

attributes.action: Let the UK Public Vote on the final Brexit deal
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, the U.K. decided to Leave the European Union. Whilst it is down to the government to get the best possible deal for a Post-EU Britain, the public should be allowed to have a vote on the final deal.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst it is down to the government to get the best possible deal for a Post-EU Britain, the public should be allowed to have a vote on the final deal, as many people voted to Leave for various reasons, as well as there being many policies those who voted for Remain liked about the EU, so this will ensure that the majority of the UK is in favour of the final Brexit deal and that it benefits all those in our country, regardless of how they voted in the referendum.

attributes.action: Investigate covert foreign interference in EU referendum and other UK elections.
attributes.background:
The CIA in the US and the BfV in Germany have both spoken of Russian attempts to manipulate elections. 
It is naive to think that the UK would somehow be exempt from or immune to such assaults. There are rumours that the EU referendum was similarly targeted, and future elections remain vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important that the full scale of any manipulation is known, so that trust in democracy in the UK is restored and any necessary precautions can be developed.

It is noteworthy that in the US/German cases, promoting a fear of immigrants has been a major tactic.

German BfV statement: (16 Nov 2016; Reuters) http://reut.rs/2gZS17j

US CIA/FBI statement: (16 Dec 2016; Washington Post) http://wapo.st/2h9yKg0

EU referendum: (14 Dec 2016; The Independent) http://ind.pn/2i2Jeh5

attributes.action: House of Commons should support the 'Taxes for Peace' Bill.
attributes.background:
The 'Taxes for Peace' bill will allow UK citizens the choice 'to divert the portion of their taxes that would ordinarily pay for military operations into a conflict prevention fund'. 
The bill was proposed by MP Ruth Cadbury on 19th July and could receive its second reading on 2nd December.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.conscienceonline.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/Taxes-for-Peace-Bill-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Changing the structure in Early Years -  increase the UK school start age
attributes.background: Having family who relocated to Finland and seeing my 2 year old niece thrive in the Finnish education system; is a wake up call for us to change the age children start school in the UK to give them a more stable start in life.
attributes.additional_details: Research says: "Children around the age of four may not be ready for the environment they encounter in the reception class, which will include having to deal not only with a curriculum that may not be tailored to their needs but also with a number of social and emotional adjustments. These factors may cause stress and anxiety". Younger children could "be affected in a negative way by their experiences in the early years". In Finland the outcomes are more balanced as children start school later.

attributes.action: Hold a second EU referendum on the grounds that demographics have now changed.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, would like to request that a second referendum on the United Kingdom's membership of the EU should be held, due to the indication that demographics are now likely to have changed across the UK and many voters regret their decision on June 23rd.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/brexit-poll-majority-uk-remain-eu-theresa-may-article-50-second-referendum-latest-a7395811.html%3Famp?client=safari

http://uk.businessinsider.com/brexit-vote-regret-leave-margin-victory-2016-10

attributes.action: Allow British citizens the same rights to live with families as EEA nationals
attributes.background:
To bring a partner or spouse in the UK, British citizens have to show income of at least £18,600 or more if they have children a rule which does not apply to settled Europeans living in the UK 

EU nationals living in the UK are allowed to bring in spouses and families from anywhere in the world.
attributes.additional_details:
How is it possible that another EU citizen has more rights to family life than a British national in the UK? 

We ask for a change to these rules to give British citizens the right to have their spouses or partners live and work with them in the UK, without the income requirements. Also to be granted the 5 year residence card, as other spouses of EU nationals are entitled to, not the 30 months given to spouses of British citizens.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of funding allocated to our police force
attributes.background: West Yorkshire Police are stretched to capacity, more funding urgently needs to be allocated to enable the force to be more effective, match capacity to demand. Currently demand outweighs capacity, officers are under huge pressure facing assaults and huge workloads. More frontline police are needed.

attributes.action: Give all ancient woodland statutory legal protection
attributes.background: Ancient woodland is recognised as irreplaceable due to the specialised plant and animal species they support, not found elsewhere. As a result of habitat loss and fragmentation over the last 50 years 60% of those specialised species have declined significantly according to the State of Nature Report
attributes.additional_details: Ancient woodlands are a vital part of our cultural heritage, often containing archaeological remains waiting to be discovered, yet 85% of it has no legal protection. If we are to commit to our climate, flood alleviation and biodiversity action plan obligations these habitats must be protected from vandalism and development. At one time woodland covered the majority of the UK, as relics of this wild wood we must ensure that our ancient woodlands survive for the benefit of future generations.

attributes.action: Stop plans to allow more secondary schools to select children by ability.
attributes.background: Selection harms children, divides communities and lowers overall attainment. The 11+ exam is inherently unfair - evidence shows that it selects on the basis of prior opportunity and social background. Poorer children, including high ability poor children, lose out most.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who fail the 11+ suffer a severe blow to their self-esteem and motivation at a critical time in their development. 
Figures suggest that these children (70-80% of the total) go on to do worse at secondary modern than they would have at a comprehensive. 
Selective areas have the largest achievement gaps in the country. 
In fully selective Bucks, the 11+ pass rate for FSM children was 4% in 2014, compared to 20% for state pupils and 53% for private school pupils.

attributes.action: Revoke the BBC's charter and privatise the company.
attributes.background: The BBC has become increasingly biased in its news coverage and is now a political pawn. In particular, with its pro-EU stance, the BBC does not represent more than half the country. However those who it does not represent are nonetheless legally bound to pay the licence fee.

attributes.action: For the term 'Accountant' to be legally defined and protected.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to have the term ‘accountant’ legally defined and protected.
attributes.additional_details: This is due to us being increasingly concerned by the poor advice businesses and individuals are being given by individuals claiming to be qualified accountants, when in fact they have had little or no professional training and lack the qualifications to deal with complex financial issues.

attributes.action: Give all parents adequate support following the sudden death of a child.
attributes.background: Research has found families in Leeds have insufficient support following the sudden death of a child. The bereavement support study, commissioned by Leeds charity Elliot’s Footprint, identified that the current level of support is ineffective, leaving bereaved parents struggling and grieving alone.
attributes.additional_details:
•	Only 16% of professionals in Leeds think that child bereavement support is currently effective
•	100% of the families who had contacted the counselling service found it unsuitable due to long waiting times or lack of child bereavement experience
•	Over 50% of professionals said they did not know who coordinated child bereavement services in Leeds and 45% saw the need for a single organisation to coordinate it

attributes.action: Make compulsory the labeling of Eggs from Caged Hens on all food products.
attributes.background: Many consumers are grateful for the opportunity to choose between purchasing free range eggs or those from caged hens. It is troubling, however, that most food products which contain egg don't specify if the eggs used are from Caged hens. This prevents consumers making an informed, ethical choice.

attributes.action: Change or ease the rules surrounding 'gardens' on baby graves.
attributes.background: 8 weeks after burying my little boy, who was born asleep in June of this year, we recieved a "rule book" stating what we can and cannot do with his resting place that a paid for. Such rules included not being able to lay stones and not coming away from the headstone by more then 12" etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I know that the rules in baby gardens and what is 'allowed' differs nationally. After being asked recently to remove ALL items from my little boy's grave, I'm petitioning to get the rules at certain cemeteries eased or changed, to allow bereaved parents to decorate their child's resting place as they see fit, providing it remains maintained by the grave 'owner'. 

Buried babies may only be a plot number to some, but they are our children and deserve their own little gardens. 

Thank you.

attributes.action: No amnesty for illegal immigrants living in Britain.
attributes.background:
Amnesty for illegal immigrants in Britain should be rejected because:
* It is wrong in principle to reward illegal behaviour.
* Amnesties have demonstrably failed in other EU countries.
attributes.additional_details:
* It would be much more effective to tighten access to the labour market and prevent fraudulent access to the welfare state.
* This would deter new arrivals and encourage illegal immigrants already here to return home.

attributes.action: Provide protection for closed railway track-beds to aid rural regeneration.
attributes.background: In the mid -1960's Dr Beeching was employed to find ways of making the railways more profitable and his report resulted in the closure of a large part of our railway network. The report failed to take into account the growth in population and the necessity for rural transport.
attributes.additional_details: The railways were mainly built under Act of Parliament. After closure Local Authorities have sold off railway land for development. Usage for footpaths and cycleways is fine. Building houses and industrial estates prevent regeneration of these railways. Scotrail have reopened part of the old Waverley route. Groups would like to reopen lines such as the Somerset, Dorset, Deeside line, Lynton & Barnstable and Matlock, Bakewell & Buxton and Cliffe Hill Mineral Railway. Local authorites should be required to aid projects and reject planning for developments.

attributes.action: To prevent seismic testing & fracking by Ineos in Dronfield & surrounding areas
attributes.background:
Ineos (owned by an offshore parent company) has been awarded the fracking rights by the Government for Dronfield and its surrounding areas. 
We believe fracking is unproven technology, environmentally damaging in numerous ways, presents a health risk to both the general public and its workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Dronfield Against Fracking oppose seismic testing & fracking for various reasons including:
1. Long term damage to countryside from an aesthetic point of view.
2. Risk of structural damage to property from damage to old mine workings from both horizontal and vertical drilling.
3. Large increase in traffic from HGV's on country roads.
4. Falling property prices.
5. Invalidate some household insurance policies from fracking damage.
6. Polluted waste water entering our water course in future years.

attributes.action: Halve UK Foreign aid and spend the £7 billion saved on the NHS
attributes.background: It is time that our elected members of parliament listened. It is wrong to spend money abroad whilst our own people are not being treated in the NHS

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit and resort back to tried and tested benefits system
attributes.background: An increasing number of customers are suffering severe hardship because of the new system. I myself have been waiting 3 months to be paid. Costs to call the service are ridiculous for those on a low income amd letters are being issued deliberatly encouraging people to waste precious money on calls.
attributes.additional_details: Increasing number of stories and requests for help are being posted online all over the country. Those of us forced onto universal credit are suffering severe hardship and un realistic sanctions aswell as ridiculous call charges to speak to ill informed poorly trained and rude staff who have no idea how to resolve issues with one member of staff admitting that letters requesting information are simply to entice people to call the premium rate telephone number. Restore the benefits system!

attributes.action: More rights for victims and family of victims of crime
attributes.background: Since our son James was killed in a hit and run, little if any consideration has been given to his rights or that of his family. Conversely, the rights of those responsible for James' death have been a constant course of consideration, allowing them to exercise those rights on more than 12 occasions
attributes.additional_details: The right to live and enjoy life was taken from James at 25 by the callous actions of Majid Malik and Kiaz Mahmood as they raced their cars at 90mph in a 40mph zone. Since that day the judicial system has continually provided opportunities for these serial criminals to exercise their rights, protecting them from facing the consequences of their actions. We have had no such rights, James' rights are ignored in favour of the criminals. Time for a change, it's the rights of victims that matter.

attributes.action: Consider making the state visit of Donald Trump as grand as possible.
attributes.background: Donald Trump has clearly stated that he wants to build on the special relationship between the US and UK, which is one of the great forces in history for justice and peace. Our countries share a deep bond military, financial, cultural and political. We should make this the grandest state visit ever.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.standard.co.uk/news/politics/donald-trump-hails-usuk-special-relationship-as-he-welcomes-theresa-may-to-the-white-house-a3452096.html

attributes.action: Implement the 10 recommendations of the APPG Inquiry Into Quality of New Homes.
attributes.background: The poor quality of new homes is not new. (NHBC, Barker Review of 2004, Office of Fair Trading Market Study of Home Building in the UK October 2008, and more recently the APPG Inquiry 2016) Yet surprisingly, there has not been any legislation to force this industry to improve.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 93% of new home buyers (at least 100,000 a year) report problems to their housebuilder. Defects that could and should have been prevented. The APPG Report is quite clear, the industry needs to be forced to improve both the quality of new homes and the indifferent service suffered by those buying new homes.

As a minimum, the government must implement the APPG Inquiry's “Key Recommendation” - the setting up of a New Homes Ombudsman by the DCLG within 3 months.

attributes.action: Osseointegration for NHS patients
attributes.background: Osseointegration is for a metal implant anchored in to the bone to all prosthetic limbs to be surgically attached. This will vastly improve people's lives. Current the U.K. Government will not fund this. This has to change
attributes.additional_details: Dr kang at the royal free hospital advised me the only way the operations would go ahead is by people pressuring government to allow funding for these operations. Join me in making this a reality and improving so many people's lives

attributes.action: Melton Mowbray needs a bypass before 4000 homes are built.
attributes.background: Due to the increased congestion in Melton Mowbray, no more houses should be built until Government funding has been secured and a bypass completed.
attributes.additional_details: a Melton bypass is desperately needed.  Sections of a proposed "Distributor Road" will be built by developers but the important section that links the roads together needs Central Government funding.  Without that link they are roads to nowhere.
